situation.title: The protection of employees
situation.meta_description: The topic describes the protection of employees.

content.processed:
Rules and recommendations

Employees are currently protected by the Labor Code as usual.

All institutes contained in the Labor Code apply regardless of whether a state of emergency is declared. Even in a state of emergency, the employer cannot deviate from the legal boundaries. At the same time, the employee, as the so-called weaker unit, is very strongly protected by law.

In practice, this means that you have the same rights as you have had so far. But so you have all your responsibilities.

questions_answers.question: Can my employer order me to take paid leave?
questions_answers.value: No, he cannot. It would be possible only after you both agreed on this, but he cannot order it himself.

questions_answers.question: Can my employer reduce my working hours?
questions_answers.value: No. It is only possible to reduce working hours in an agreement with the employee.

questions_answers.question: Is it possible to work from home when I am in a quarantine?
Can my employer cancel or change my shifts the day before?
questions_answers.value: No, he can’t. The change of the shift schedule can be made by the employer only 2 weeks in advance, unless otherwise agreed with the employee.

questions_answers.question: Can an employer fire me immediately because of Covid?
When do I have a right to refuse to work?
questions_answers.value: An employee may refuse to perform his work when the work directly endangers his life or health, or the life or health of others. Such a refusal cannot be considered as a breach of the employee’s obligations. However, the law does not protect employees who (for these reasons) refuse to work purposefully. (Section 106 of the Labor Code).
